Specific Details: General discussion on a number of topics with respect to post-primary education.
Subject Matter: General discussion on a number of topics with respect to post-primary education.
Intended Results: The meeting was by way of introduction and not intended to secure any goal beyond that.

To participate in a briefing about the use of electronic collars (e - collars) in the training of dogs not to attack livestock.::To highlight that, considering banning the use of these important tools for training dogs is a retrograde step in the pursuit of better animal welfare and has no basis in science, fact or common sense.::To stress that it is not acceptable that an important tool in the training of dogs with how they should interact with livestock and indeed humans is taken away.::To highlight that banning these products would inadvertently intensify the challenges faced by dog owners and farmers. Without this important tool, controlling and training dogs becomes more challenging, inevitably resulting in increased instances of attacks on livestock. this will have serious implications for the livelihoods of farmers and the wellbeing of animals.
Person primarily responsible for lobbyin: Adrian Gallagher IFA Sheep Chair, James Walsh IFA Policy Executive
